text:
Hi Team we used to use api key previous to get contact list but as now api key will be depreciated, how can i get the contact list
```<https://api.hubapi.com/contacts/v1/lists/dynamic?hapikey>```
this end point we use to use to get contact list
I have created new aceess token how can i use it to get the contact list can anyone please guide which endpoint we need to use

Hello <@U048B8BAY15>
You'll have to update the API request. Instead of sending API key through query parameter, you need to send the access token through header as bearer token.
You'll find the things from here: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/contacts>

<@U03ADFUTHDW> can you please for this what is the new endpoint
```    let hubSpotUrl = `<https://api.hubapi.com/contacts/v1/lists/${HubSpot_contact_list_id}/contacts/recent?hapikey=${secret_key}&count=${count}&formSubmissionMode=none&showListMemberships=false>`;```
and what must be the token key name am using postman for testing
Your endpoint will be same, just remove the query parameter (hapikey). And set your access token in authentication method like this..

for getting contact list will it be the same endpoint or different end point
```<https://api.hubapi.com/contacts/v1/lists/dynamic?hapikey>```
<@U03ADFUTHDW>

<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/lists/get_lists?_ga=2.262849292.1861470363.1667196130-1762454292.1640862892>
Refer this
Still let me know if you're not clear with the document.

Hey there everyone <#C2YHAHB6K|api>
I want to know if these docs are going to sunset or not -> <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/ecomm-bridge/v2/ecommerce-bridge-overview>
<@U03ADFUTHDW> What issue are you facing ?
Thanks a lot <@U03ADFUTHDW>

Hi everyone,
I'm currently working on migrating our HubSpot integrations from using API keys to private/public apps. I want to install the integration multiple times (on different URLs) and eventually publish it to the Marketplace. I am not sure whether to create a private or public app for this integration. The problem with the public app is that with the upcoming change, a redirect URL will be required. The URLs are not known upfront however.
What would you recommend? Using a private app and create credentials for each installation of the integration or create a public app?
Yes, currently you can't create an app with the ecommerce bridge extension and on december 1 the apis will be fully depricated
Private apps are just ways to authenicate with the apis. Publics apps can also do this but they also have some operational functionality like: CRM Cards, Workflow actions, Webhooks etc.
So if you're only trying to use the apis and aren't trying to build a intergration I would suggest just creating a private app for you own portal
If you're trying to build out an intergration for multiple portal, use public apps. But remember public apps will need a server to handle the auth
Okay, thanks a lot! So if I would create a public app, I would need an extra server that handles the authentification. And this server would represent the auth url?
Yep exactly
What is your preferred background language?
What do you mean by background language?
For example: Python, Node, Rust, PHP Etc
This language will be used for your auth server

Hi <#C2YHAHB6K|api> channel,

I am trying to push the record ID into my 3rd party app when calling a contact from HubSpot, using the same said 3rd party app. Does anyone know how I can achieve this?

Scenario;
1. find contact
2. click call on contact
3. this opens 3rd party app (this is used for calling)
4. load the Record ID into a data field in the 3rd party app
5. 3rd party app uses the record ID, to push data back into contacts call log in HubSpot (i.e disposition / agent name etc)
Hi, everyone! Anyone know what format the endpoint URL should be in for button settings under app settings?
Just make sure not to have https:// inside of the text box. <http://yahoo.com|yahoo.com> is an example
The endpoint needs to communicate of SSL fyi (https vs http)
Hi,

Hi, I am creating a custom object to group data that already exists in HubSpot. For example a custom object for campaigns that are not email campaigns. I want to use data from UTM parameters and Campaign analytics as my schema. Is there a way to store this data into my custom object once I create the object and schema. Do I need to do workflow automation?
Yep I think workflows are defniitely the way to go for this
Thanks <@U01QVR44MEY> I will keep you updated on the process. So I do not to populate the schema manually when I use workflows
Not the schema just create the objects as they come through
<@U01QVR44MEY> please could you explain with more detail
So as the data comes into HS, it is stored in the custom object I create.  What happens to the data already stored prior to creating the custom object
What do you mean?
Hi guys, my company is just starting to use HubSpot. We have a bit of custom logic to assign sales rep. I'd like to setup a webhook to listen on the "contact.created" event. How do I set that up?
I see that webhook is not available for private apps. Does that mean I have to get a developer account and create a public app to do this?

Having an issue with a Salesforce integration.   All of the sudden I am getting this error on 31K objects-  Salesforce API Error: Salesforce Object not found - In addition, Im getting a duplicate error as well... I tested a form and used a test name and this is the error I just got and this has not happened in the past.
Yep it does
Pretty easy to setup, just create the app and then install it on the account, and it will send a webhook everytime a contact is created
You could also use workflow to do this without an app
I don't know why this error is popping up but I bet <@U01JT537HG9> knows
so we're trying to use workflow, but there doesn't seem to be a contact.created event. Is it ok to just say created_date changed and it is "today"?
or is there a better way?
You can use createdate known
cool

Hi there Dev community!

Curious if anyone knows where i can get a full list of default properties for engagements in HS CRM? I see all the documentation on object default properties but I’d like lists for calls/emails/meetings/tasks etc :thinking_face:  any help would be appreciated! Seems support gets confused and just sends me links to the objects….if i can search the CRM for engagements….would be super helpful to see the default properties for those. :eyes:

I know i can make a request to the properties endpoint but i want to know which of these are default vs not.

{
  “propertyName”: [
    “Call and meeting type”,
    “Business units”,
    “At-Mentioned Owner Ids”,
    “Attached file IDs”,
    “Call notes preview”,
    “HTML Body Preview”,
    “Body Preview Truncated”,
    “Integrating App ID”,
    “Authenticated recording files url provider”,
    “Call notes”,
    “Callee object id”,
    “Callee object type”,
    “Call direction”,
    “Call outcome”,
    “Call duration”,
    “External Account ID”,
    “External ID”,
    “From Number”,
    “Transcript Available”,
    “Voicemail Available”,
    “Recording URL”,
    “Call Source”,
    “Call status”,
    “Call Title”,
    “To Number”,
    “Tracked terms”,
    “Call transcription id”,
    “Video url”,
    “Unique Zoom Meeting ID”,
    “Calls Service Call ID”,
    “Activity created by”,
    “Created by user ID”,
    “Create date”,
    “Engagement Source”,
    “Engagement Source ID”,
    “Follow up action”,
    “GDPR deleted”,
    “Last modified date”,
    “Merged object IDs”,
    “Updated by”,
    “Record ID”,
    “Product name”,
    “Queue Memberships”,
    “Read Only Object”,
    “Activity date”,
    “Unique creation key”,
    “Unique ID”,
    “Unknown Visitor Conversation”,
    “Updated by user ID”,
    “User IDs of all notification followers”,
    “User IDs of all notification unfollowers”,
    “User IDs of all owners”,
    “Owner Assigned Date”,
    “Activity assigned to”,
    “HubSpot Team”,
    “All owner ids”,
    “All team ids”,
    “All accessible team ids”
  ]
}
“HubSpotDefined”: true,    :point_left:   does this identify default properties?
OR is it easier than that and all properties for engagements are default but you can add custom property values? (like custom meeting/call types or call outcomes/dispositions?) :thinking_face:
Yeah I didn't test through the schemas api but you can't create properties through the ui.
So all those properties are the default but just like you said you can create different options for those properties
gotcha - that makes sense, thanks <@U01QVR44MEY>. I’ll make my own lists then :+1:
Of course, share it here when you're done :laughing:
I only needed calls/emails/meetings but they’re here :joy:
<@U01QVR44MEY> Thanks Carter, is there any doc available for new coded flow ?
